intro: Dendropanax parvifloroides var. chartaceus, commonly known as the paper-leaf arrowhead, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves that are often thin and papery in texture. Native to parts of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. The leaves are typically arranged alternately along the stem, and the plant produces small, greenish-white flowers. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
